column1: Towards Better Accuracy and Robustness with Localized Adversarial Training

column2: Tingting Chen@California State Polytechnic University Pomona
column3: Hao Ji@California State Polytechnic University Pomona

column1: As technology and society grow increasingly dependent on computer vision
column2: it becomes important to make sure that these technologies are secure. However
column3: even todayâ€™s stateof-the-art classifiers are easily fooled by carefully manipulated images. The only solutions that have increased robustness against these manipulated images have come at the expense of accuracy on natural inputs. In this work
column4: we propose a new training technique
column6: that results in more accurate classification of both both natural and adversarial images by as much as 6.5% and 99.7%
